intro: Deyeuxia spathacea, commonly known as the narrowleaf sedges, is a grass-like plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its triangular, ribbed stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in moist to wet habitats such as marshes, wetlands, and stream banks. Deyeuxia spathacea is often found in temperate regions and can form dense vegetation in its native environment. Its flowers are small and clustered in spikelets, typical of the sedge family.
